analyzed: rgyur/_/dbang ni rnam pa bzhi ru bshad/_/nges tshhig blugs shing bkrugs pa 'di

analyzed: ltar de yang tshag kra zhing bsgom pa'i dus su lte bar sgom tsham na sems su go yang bzhi pa bya bas ston par

analyzed: rgyud 'dir las kyi phyag rgya dang sbyor ba'i pad+mar las skad cig ma bzhis dus tshhon gyi dgye

analyzed: nas brtshis pa'i dga' ba dang sbyar ni dga' ba'o skad cig bzhi dang sbyar na sna tshhogs so/_/dga' ba bzhi'i

analyzed: rang bzhin rtog par bya ba dgongs ste/_sdig pa'i chos rnams las ring du song
translated: The master is one who has gone far from sinful dharmas and is🔽endowed with the movement of the four joys.

analyzed: zhing /_rgyu bas slob dpon no/_/gzhan du na bya ba'i rgyud la cod pan la sogs pa ku ru

analyzed: dbang du bshad do zhe na sogs pa dang /_thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i dbang

analyzed: thob pa phyir drug po tsham la slob dpon gyi nang gi dbang tsham du bstan pa ni ma yin te/ 'dir slob dpon gyi dbang thob pas rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud gang

analyzed: mnyan pa dang bsam pa dang /_bsgom pa'i skal ba can du bya ba'i phyir/_slob

original: nas gsang ba dang shes rab dri ba dang bzhi pa'i mtshhan nyid bzhir nye bar mtshhon
analyzed: nas gsang ba dang shes rab dri ba dang bzhi pa'i mtshhan nyid bzhir nye bar mtshhon
translated: The four initiations are indicated by the four characteristics of the master initiation, the secret initiation, the initiation of wisdom, and the fourth initiation, in the same way that the stages of manifest realization are meditated upon.

original: zhing shes par bya'o/_/de ltar dbang po tha ma dbang bskur ba la slob dpon gyi nang gi dbang
analyzed: zhing shes par bya'o/_/de ltar dbang po tha ma dbang bskur ba la slob dpon gyi nang gi dbang
translated: In that way, the empowerment of the lowest capability is the inner empowerment of the master.

original: thob pa dga' bzhi dbang po gnas pad mar tha ma'i lhag de la rang lus thabs ldan rtsha rlung gi man ngag phog
analyzed: thob pa dga' bzhi dbang po gnas pad mar tha ma'i lhag de la rang lus thabs ldan rtsha rlung gi man ngag phog
translated: The four joys are obtained, and the bindu of the final stage is stabilized in the lotus.🔽The intimate instruction of the vāyu and the method of one’s body is applied.

original: ste bskyed rim sgom du gzhug par mos pa'i shes par byas la/_las kyi phyag rgya dang ldan par
analyzed: ste bskyed rim sgom du gzhug par mos pa'i shes par byas la/_las kyi phyag rgya dang ldan par
translated: One should imagine that the creation stage is set in equipoise.

original: spros pa'i de las pad+ma'i nang du dga' ba bzhi sbyor ba de yang lha'i bskyed rim gyi bsam gtan gyi man ngag
analyzed: spros pa'i de las pad+ma'i nang du dga' ba bzhi sbyor ba de yang lha'i bskyed rim gyi bsam gtan gyi man ngag
translated: The intimate instruction of concentration on the creation stage of the deity is explained.🔽The secret empowerment is explained.

original: bstan par bya'o//_// gsang dbang bstan pa de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la yang gsang dbang ni las rgya
analyzed: bstan par bya'o//_// gsang dbang bstan pa de ltar rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la yang gsang dbang ni las rgya
translated: The secret empowerment is applied with an action mudra.🔽The instant and so on are understood.

original: dang sbyar ba'o skad cig la sogs pa ni go bar zad do gsang bar 'bring la dbang snga ma bzhin du bskur la gnas
analyzed: dang sbyar ba'o skad cig la sogs pa ni go bar zad do gsang bar 'bring la dbang snga ma bzhin du bskur la gnas
translated: The secret empowerment is conferred on the medium in the same way as before.

original: pa'i nor bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhal du zhugs nas byang sems kyi ngo bor yi ge hum gi ngo bor bsams nas skad bzhi'i🔽bor ro/_/bla mas bstan pa gang yin par rdo rje nor bu'i nang du bzhi cang rtshi ba'o/_/skad cig
analyzed: pa'i nor bu de bzhin gshegs pa zhal du zhugs nas byang sems kyi ngo bor yi ge hum gi ngo bor bsams nas skad bzhi'i bor ro/_/bla mas bstan pa gang yin par rdo rje nor bu'i nang du bzhi cang rtshi ba'o/_/skad cig
translated: The jewel enters the mouth of the tathagata and is imagined as the essence of bodhicitta in the form of the syllable hum.🔽The four joys are experienced in the four moments.

original: ma bzhis dga' ba bzhi nyams su myong ba de ni dbang ba'i dbang zhes bya bar

analyzed: brjod do/_/spros pa'i bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor pa rnams la gsang ba'i phyir ro/_/'dis dbang bskur dbang po 'bring po rnams la dgyes pa rdo rje yab yum gyis snyoms

analyzed: snang ba gsum du tsham du shes par bya'o/_/de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur na/

analyzed: om rdo rje ma hum badzra ming che ge mo stam ba rengs par ro ya hu~m hum phat swa ha/_zhes bya ba stong

analyzed: ngam brgya rtsha brgyad du bzlas na bcings par bcings par ro 'gyur ro/_/de bzhin
translated: In the same way, generate compassion from the letter i, and summon the one to be bound.

analyzed: du yi ge i las byung ba'i 'go ri snying rje bskyed dgug par byas pa la rang gi snying kar pam las pad+ma ram
translated: In one’s heart center, a lotus arises from paṃ, a sun from raṃ, and a moon from a.🔽Upon that, an i emits light, makes offerings to the noble ones, benefits sentient beings, and melts into light.

original: las nyi ma a las zla ba de'i steng du i las 'phros 'phags mchod sems can don byas slar 'od du zhu ba las lha mo 'go ri
analyzed: las nyi ma a las zla ba de'i steng du i las 'phros 'phags mchod sems can don byas slar 'od du zhu ba las lha mo 'go ri

original: ma gur kum gyi mdog can g.yas na zhags pa g.yon na lcags kyu thogs pa bsgoms la/
analyzed: ma gur kum gyi mdog can g.yas na zhags pa g.yon na lcags kyu thogs pa bsgoms la/
translated: She is the color of saffron, holds a noose in the right hand and a goad in the left hand.

original: lha mo de'i snying kar yi ge pad+ma zla ba'i steng du e gur kum gyi mdog ltar dmar ba bsams
analyzed: lha mo de'i snying kar yi ge pad+ma zla ba'i steng du e gur kum gyi mdog ltar dmar ba bsams

analyzed: nas/_bzlas pa ni om e swa ha/_zhes bya ba'i sngags 'bum phrag gcig du bzlas
translated: The recitation is the mantra of Om E Svaha, which is recited one hundred thousand times.

original: nas/ pas bsnyen pa bya'o/_/las kyi sbyor thabs ni de nas bsgrub po bya ba gcer bu skra bkrol
analyzed: nas/ pas bsnyen pa bya'o/_/las kyi sbyor thabs ni de nas bsgrub po bya ba gcer bu skra bkrol
translated: The method of application of the rite is that then the practitioner,

analyzed: ba mdog dmar ba mdun du bsams la/_bud med yin na skye gnas su a dmar po me'i mdog can bsam mo/_/skyes pa yin na snying kar bsams ste/_bud med la skye
translated: who is naked, with loose hair, and red in color, is imagined in front. If it is a woman, in the vagina one should imagine a red A🔽the color of fire. If it is a man, one should imagine it at the heart.🔽For a woman, the letter I blazes with fire in the vagina,

original: gnas su yi ge i las me 'bar ba'o mar 'dzag cing 'od kyi bsgrub bya myos par bsams la/
analyzed: gnas su yi ge i las me 'bar ba'o mar 'dzag cing 'od kyi bsgrub bya myos par bsams la/
translated: and one imagines that the victim melts with the dripping nectar and is intoxicated with light.

original: ri ming lha mo 'go'u ri ming che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyur cig_/am swa ha/_zhes bya ba🔽zlos shing mgrin pa'i zhags pas bcings nas snying ka lcags kyus phug ste drangs
analyzed: ri ming lha mo 'go'u ri ming che ge mo bdag gi dbang du gyur cig_/am swa ha/_zhes bya ba zlos shing mgrin pa'i zhags pas bcings nas snying ka lcags kyus phug ste drangs
translated: One recites, “Om, so-and-so, the goddess of such-and-such a mountain, come under my control, Om Svaha.”

original: nas rkang pa'i drung du 'gel bar bsgoms na gdon mi za bar dbang du 'gyur ro//
analyzed: nas rkang pa'i drung du 'gel bar bsgoms na gdon mi za bar dbang du 'gyur ro//
translated: One imagines that one binds with the noose around the neck, pierces the heart with the hook, and drags the victim to one’s feet. If one practices in this way, one will certainly gain control.

original: sngon du snying rje bskyed la bskrod par byas la snying khar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de'i steng du de bzhin du yi ge i
analyzed: sngon du snying rje bskyed la bskrod par byas la snying khar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de'i steng du de bzhin du yi ge i
translated: Having previously generated compassion, one should expel [the vāyu] and meditate on a lotus from paṃ and a moon from a at the heart.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Commentary on the Difficult Points of the Śrī Hevajra Tantra called Ratnaśekhara states:

analyzed: las byung ba ni i las 'od 'phros 'phags pa mchod sems can don byas slar 'dus zhu ba las rnal 'byor
translated: “The arising of the action [vāyu] is the light that radiates from i. Having made offerings to the āryas and benefited sentient beings, it returns and melts into the yoginī

analyzed: ma chu ma mdog sngon mo phyag g.yas na tho ba dang g.yon sdigs mdzub bsnams pa

analyzed: bsgoms la/_lha mo de'i snying kar nyi ma la khang sngon po bsams ste/_om kham swa ha/

analyzed: zhes bya ba bzlas pa 'bum phrag gcig byas pas/_bsnyen pa byas pas de nas
translated: Having performed the approach recitation of 100,000 [repetitions],🔽the object of practice is naked, with loose hair, blue in color,

analyzed: bsgrub bya gcer bu skra bkrol ba mdog sngon po/_rnga mo sngon mi'i rgyab du bskyon
translated: riding on the back of a blue donkey,🔽beaten on the back with a wrathful club,

original: la/_khro bo'i dbyug pas rgyab nas rdeg cing /_kha lhor ltas te 'bros par
analyzed: la/_khro bo'i dbyug pas rgyab nas rdeg cing /_kha lhor ltas te 'bros par

original: bsgoms na/_/a+o~m kham ba ri yo gi ni che ge mo u tsha ta ya kham hu~m hu~m hu~m phat/_zhes
analyzed: bsgoms na/_/a+o~m kham ba ri yo gi ni che ge mo u tsha ta ya kham hu~m hu~m hu~m phat/_zhes
translated: If one meditates on this, and recites Oṃ khaṃ vajra-yoginī such-and-such, uccaṭa ya khaṃ huṃ huṃ huṃ phaṭ,🔽then the target will be expelled in seven days.

original: bzlas na nyi ma bdun gyis bskrad par 'gyur ro/_/yang sngon du snying rje bskyed de nye ba dbye'o/_/🔽mnos la snying khar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de steng du u las 'od 'phros 'phags mchod sems can don byas tshhur 'dus

analyzed: pa las de bzhin du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma yi ge u las bskyed pa bsgom ste/_bzlas pa
translated: Having taken the vow, one should meditate on Vajraḍāka generated from the syllable oṃ, on a lotus from paṃ, on a moon from a, and on top of that, light radiating from u, making offerings to the āryas, benefiting sentient beings, and gathering back.🔽When one performs the recitation, one should imagine a blue jī at the heart of the goddess, revolving.

original: byed tsham na lha mo de'i snying kar nyi ma la dzi sngon po bsams la 'khor bar ro/_om dzi swa ha/
analyzed: byed tsham na lha mo de'i snying kar nyi ma la dzi sngon po bsams la 'khor bar ro/_om dzi swa ha/

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'bum bzlas pas bsnyan pa byas nas/_las kyi sbyor ba bstan pa ni bsgrub bya

analyzed: rta dang ma he la zhon pa phan tshhun 'thab par bsgoms la/_rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma om dzi
translated: The application of the rite is as follows: One should meditate on the target mounted on a horse and buffalo, fighting with each other, and the Vajraḍāka goddess, oṃ jī

analyzed: badzra d+ha kyi ni bsgrub bya'i ming che ge mo dang che ge mo 'byed pa'o ra bi sha ku ru/_dzi hum hum hum

analyzed: phat zhes bzlas na phan tshhun 'byed pa'o dgrar 'gyur ro/_/yang sngon la snying rje bskyed la bstan

analyzed: pa la gnod pa byed pa dpyad bya'i snyam pa'i sems bskyed la rang gi snying gar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de'i steng du a las

analyzed: 'od 'phros 'phags mchod sems can don byas slar 'dus pa 'od du zhu ba las de bzhin du yi ge a las

analyzed: byung ba'i bdag med ma zang gri dang g.yas thod pa dang g.yon kha tam kha bsnams pa rnam
translated: From that arises Vajravārāhī, holding a flaying knife and skull cup in her right and left hands,🔽with a terrifying form.

analyzed: par 'jigs pa'i gzugs can bsgoms la lha mo de'i snying gar nyi ma la brum sngon po

analyzed: bltas ste/_o~m snga swa ha zhes snga ma ltar bsnyen pa byas nas/_las la sbyor ba'i thabs bstan pa

analyzed: bram ze'i thod par dug dang skye tshhe dang lan tshha dang khrag rnams kyis 'khor lo zur

analyzed: du rang gi a bon las byung ba'i yang sngon du snying rje bskyed la snying khar pad+ma dang zla ba'i steng du a las

original: me tog ltar dmar ba bsgom la/_lha mo de'i snying gar hum bsgoms te/_bsnyen pa
analyzed: me tog ltar dmar ba bsgom la/_lha mo de'i snying gar hum bsgoms te/_bsnyen pa
translated: The light returns and dissolves into light, from which arises a red Pukkasi, the color of a jasmine flower.🔽Meditate on the mantra recitation as before.🔽When tired, recite “Oṃ huṃ svāhā.”

original: snga ma ltar bya'o sngags bzlas so tsha na om hu~m swa ha zhes bzlas so/_/de nas rlung dang las kyi sbyor ba
analyzed: snga ma ltar bya'o sngags bzlas so tsha na om hu~m swa ha zhes bzlas so/_/de nas rlung dang las kyi sbyor ba
translated: Next, the teaching on the application of the vāyu and karma is as follows:

original: bstan pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya myos par 'gyur bar bsams la/
analyzed: bstan pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du bsgrub bya myos par 'gyur bar bsams la/
translated: On top of the maṇḍala of fire, imagine the person to be subjugated.

original: rnal 'byor pa rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer mdog dmar po spros ste/🔽bsgrub bya'i sna sgo g.yas par zhugs nas/_snying phug ste/_slar sna sgo g.yon
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'od zer mdog dmar po spros ste/ bsgrub bya'i sna sgo g.yas par zhugs nas/_snying phug ste/_slar sna sgo g.yon
translated: From the seed syllable in the heart of the practitioner, red light rays radiate🔽and enter the right nostril of the person to be subjugated.🔽After filling his heart, the light exits through the left nostril

original: nas byung nas/_rang gi snying ga'i rnal 'byor pa sa bon la bcug ste/_rang gi
analyzed: nas byung nas/_rang gi snying ga'i rnal 'byor pa sa bon la bcug ste/_rang gi
translated: and enters the seed syllable of the practitioner in one’s heart.

original: dbugs kyi rlung gis bkug la sngags bzlas na gdon mi za bar 'gugs par
analyzed: dbugs kyi rlung gis bkug la sngags bzlas na gdon mi za bar 'gugs par
translated: When the mantra is recited, the vāyu of the practitioner draws it in and🔽it is definitely summoned.

original: 'gyur ro/_/de bzhin du rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i yang sngon du snying rje bsgoms la rang gi
analyzed: 'gyur ro/_/de bzhin du rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i yang sngon du snying rje bsgoms la rang gi
translated: Likewise, having first meditated on compassion, visualize a lotus from one’s seed syllable, an āḥ, and a moon.

original: snying kar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de'i steng du om las 'od 'phros 'phags pa mchod sems can don byas slar 'dus zhu
analyzed: snying kar pam las pad+ma a las zla ba de'i steng du om las 'od 'phros 'phags pa mchod sems can don byas slar 'dus zhu
translated: On top of that, an oṃ emits light, makes offerings to the āryas, benefits sentient beings, and returns.

original: ba las mkha' spyod ma kha dog nag mo bsgoms la lha mo de'i snying gar yi ge glu bsams ste/
analyzed: ba las mkha' spyod ma kha dog nag mo bsgoms la lha mo de'i snying gar yi ge glu bsams ste/
translated: From the melting of the light, meditate on black Khecarī. In the heart of that goddess, imagine the syllable song.

original: om ku swa ha snga ma ltar bsnyen pa byas nas las la sbyor ba bsgrub bya kha thur du bstan pa'i
analyzed: om ku swa ha snga ma ltar bsnyen pa byas nas las la sbyor ba bsgrub bya kha thur du bstan pa'i
translated: Om ku svāhā. Having recited the approach as before, apply it to the activity.

original: bshad pa'i lam du yi ge glu las byung ba'i rdo rje 'od 'bar ba bsams sngags su gnas
analyzed: bshad pa'i lam du yi ge glu las byung ba'i rdo rje 'od 'bar ba bsams sngags su gnas
translated: In the path of the explanation, imagine a blazing vajra from the syllable song.

original: pa'i la/_mkha' spyod ma om glu khe pu tsha ri bsgrub bya'i ming che ge mo ma ra ya sad hu~m hum hum phat/
analyzed: pa'i la/_mkha' spyod ma om glu khe pu tsha ri bsgrub bya'i ming che ge mo ma ra ya sad hu~m hum hum phat/
translated: In the path of the mantra, recite the mantra of Khecarī, oṃ khecarī kīlī kīlī kīlī hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: zhes bzlas na gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro/_/
analyzed: zhes bzlas na gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro/_/
translated: If one recites that, there is no doubt that the victim will die.

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/
translated: The Precious Rosary of Heruka's Difficult Points

original: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba las/
analyzed: dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba las/
translated: The Precious Rosary of Heruka's Difficult Points

original: rim par phye ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o/_/
analyzed: rim par phye ba gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o/_/
translated: is the explanation of the second chapter.

original: las de rnam spyir rangs pa la rang gi snying khar bsgrub pa la bsrung ba la sogs pa sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge
analyzed: las de rnam spyir rangs pa la rang gi snying khar bsgrub pa la bsrung ba la sogs pa sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge
translated: In general, for those actions, one should protect oneself with mantras, mudras, and samadhi, such as protection, and so on, at one's heart.

original: 'dzin gyis bsrung ba byas pa yod pas de rang gi snying khar nas 'od zer 'phros pas bsgrub bya'i lus la phog gnas lo'i🔽bsrung ba thams cad phrogs par bsam/_mkha' 'gro'i snying kha nas ye shes sems dpa' yod pa de la gsol ba btab
analyzed: 'dzin gyis bsrung ba byas pa yod pas de rang gi snying khar nas 'od zer 'phros pas bsgrub bya'i lus la phog gnas lo'i bsrung ba thams cad phrogs par bsam/_mkha' 'gro'i snying kha nas ye shes sems dpa' yod pa de la gsol ba btab
translated: Since there is that, light rays emanate from one's heart, striking the body of the one to be protected, and one imagines that all the protection of the life-force is stolen.🔽From the heart of the dakini, the wisdom being is present there, and one supplicates that and thinks, Do not remain in that violation of the sacred pledge.

original: la dam tshhig nyams pa de la ma 'dug shig ces bya bar bsam mo/_/de kun gyi thun mong du bya'o/_//_de nas zhes
analyzed: la dam tshhig nyams pa de la ma 'dug shig ces bya bar bsam mo/_/de kun gyi thun mong du bya'o/_//_de nas zhes
translated: That is to be done in common with all of them.🔽Then,

original: bya ba la sogs pa la lha zhes bya ba ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor pa rnams so/_/
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa la lha zhes bya ba ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor pa rnams so/_/
translated: The deities in the phrase the deities and so forth are the practitioners of Hevajra.

original: rim par phye ba zhes bya ba ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bye brag🔽ji lta bu bzhin du rgyas par bstan pa'o/_/dang po byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: rim par phye ba zhes bya ba ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'i cho ga bye brag ji lta bu bzhin du rgyas par bstan pa'o/_/dang po byams pa zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: The divisions in the phrase the divisions of the tantra are the various rituals of the Hevajra Tantra and so forth.🔽The in detail in the phrase in detail means that they are taught extensively.

original: pa la/_dang po zhes bya ba ni snying rje la ltos pa ste/_gzhan du na thams cad kyi🔽dang por yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su stan 'jam po la sgrub pa po 'dug ste/_bdag🔽gi lus dang dang gnas dang rnal 'byor ting nge 'dzin la bsrung ba'i phyir/_rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi
analyzed: pa la/_dang po zhes bya ba ni snying rje la ltos pa ste/_gzhan du na thams cad kyi dang por yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su stan 'jam po la sgrub pa po 'dug ste/_bdag gi lus dang dang gnas dang rnal 'byor ting nge 'dzin la bsrung ba'i phyir/_rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi
translated: The first in the phrase first, loving kindness and so forth is in reference to compassion; otherwise, it would be the first of all.🔽In a pleasant place, the practitioner sits on a soft seat and, for the sake of protecting his body, place, and yoga of meditative concentration, he recites the mantra of Vajrayaksha: Om rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: sngags pa om rak+sha rak+sha hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha bsrung ba'i sgo nas tshhogs bsag pa dang /_zhes lan
analyzed: sngags pa om rak+sha rak+sha hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha bsrung ba'i sgo nas tshhogs bsag pa dang /_zhes lan
translated: By means of this protection, he gathers the accumulations and, as stated in the Guhyasamaja Tantra, having gathered the accumulations, one should meditate on the deity.

original: gsum bzlas nas mdun du dbang po dman pa yin pas zhing sprul mi nus pas so ras ris la sogs
analyzed: gsum bzlas nas mdun du dbang po dman pa yin pas zhing sprul mi nus pas so ras ris la sogs
translated: Having recited the three seed syllables, in front of the painting and so forth,

original: pa'i bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mchod de/_rdzas ni arga la sogs pa la rang rang
analyzed: pa'i bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mchod de/_rdzas ni arga la sogs pa la rang rang
translated: offerings of substances such as argha and so forth, which have been enchanted with their respective mantras, should be offered.

original: gi sngags bzlas la mchod de de nas sdig pa bshags pa dang /_bsod nams kyi rjes
analyzed: gi sngags bzlas la mchod de de nas sdig pa bshags pa dang /_bsod nams kyi rjes
translated: Then, having confessed one's sins and rejoiced in the merit of all sentient beings,

original: su yid rang ba dang /_dgyes rdor lta bu de'i sngags chos de'i 'khor na dge 'dun no/_/gsum la
analyzed: su yid rang ba dang /_dgyes rdor lta bu de'i sngags chos de'i 'khor na dge 'dun no/_/gsum la
translated: one should go for refuge to the Three Jewels,

original: skyabs su 'gro ba byas nas/_byang chub kyi sems nye bar 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad de
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba byas nas/_byang chub kyi sems nye bar 'khor ba'i sems can thams cad de
translated: and having generated the thought of awakening, one should establish all sentient beings in the state of Cakrasaṃvara.

original: kho na dgyes rdor gyi lam la gzhag par bya'o/_/de nas byams pa la sogs pa bya ste/
analyzed: kho na dgyes rdor gyi lam la gzhag par bya'o/_/de nas byams pa la sogs pa bya ste/
translated: Then one should perform loving kindness and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad he badzra'i bde ba la dgod par bya'o snyam pa ni byams pa'o/_/
analyzed: sems can thams cad he badzra'i bde ba la dgod par bya'o snyam pa ni byams pa'o/_/
translated: The thought, I will establish all sentient beings in the bliss of Hevajra, is loving kindness.

original: de'i 'og tu bde ba'i stobs kyi de rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad he brdza'i bde ba'i stobs kyis
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bde ba'i stobs kyi de rnams kyi sdug bsngal thams cad he brdza'i bde ba'i stobs kyis
translated: After that, the thought, By the power of bliss, I will remove all the suffering of those sentient beings, is compassion.

original: bsal snyam pa ni snying rje'o/_/de rnams nyid lha'i he badzra'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad🔽par bya'o snyam pa ni dga' ba'o/_/de rnams nyid nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon
analyzed: bsal snyam pa ni snying rje'o/_/de rnams nyid lha'i he badzra'i bde ba rgyun mi 'chad par bya'o snyam pa ni dga' ba'o/_/de rnams nyid nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon
translated: Joy is thinking, “I will cause the bliss of Hevajra to be uninterrupted for them.”

original: mongs pa'i gtang nas de kho na banyen por gyur pa'i he badzra'i lam gyis nye bar bsdus ste/
analyzed: mongs pa'i gtang nas de kho na banyen por gyur pa'i he badzra'i lam gyis nye bar bsdus ste/
translated: Equanimity is thinking, “I will gather them near with the path of Hevajra, which is the antidote to the afflictions and the branch afflictions, and I will place them in thatness.”

original: gzhag go snyam pa ni btang snyoms so/_/de dag ni rnal 'byor rab 'bring kun gyi
analyzed: gzhag go snyam pa ni btang snyoms so/_/de dag ni rnal 'byor rab 'bring kun gyi
translated: Those are the common preliminaries for all yogas, superior, middling, and inferior.

original: thun mong du dang por bya ba'i yan lag go/_/rnal 'byor gyi lus stong nyid gsungs
analyzed: thun mong du dang por bya ba'i yan lag go/_/rnal 'byor gyi lus stong nyid gsungs
translated: The body of the yoga is taught to be emptiness:🔽Then, after that branch, the body should be meditated on first.

original: pa/_de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste/_yan lag de nas de'i 'og tu lus kyi dang por bsgom par bya'o/_/ci zhig zhe na stong nyid stong pa byang chub ste/_phyi rol gyi
analyzed: pa/_de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste/_yan lag de nas de'i 'og tu lus kyi dang por bsgom par bya'o/_/ci zhig zhe na stong nyid stong pa byang chub ste/_phyi rol gyi
translated: What? Emptiness, emptiness, enlightenment.🔽In order to abandon the ordinary appearances of the body with the mind, visualize the external

original: dngos po rnams yid kyis tha mal pa'i snang ba'i lus spang ba'i phyir dmigs la/_yul 'di
analyzed: dngos po rnams yid kyis tha mal pa'i snang ba'i lus spang ba'i phyir dmigs la/_yul 'di
translated: entities.

original: dag ni yang dag par dngos su yod pa ma yin te/_yul du snang ba 'di ni sems 'khrul pa
analyzed: dag ni yang dag par dngos su yod pa ma yin te/_yul du snang ba 'di ni sems 'khrul pa
translated: The objects that appear are not really and truly existent, because this🔽appearance of objects is the deluded mind itself appearing in the aspect of

original: nyid yul gyi rnam par snang bas gcig du rmi lam lta bur bsams la/_de ltar
analyzed: nyid yul gyi rnam par snang bas gcig du rmi lam lta bur bsams la/_de ltar
translated: objects. Just like a dream, they are one and many.

original: snang ba'i sems tsham po de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas/
analyzed: snang ba'i sems tsham po de yang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas/
translated: The mind that appears in that way is also free from a nature of one or🔽many. Therefore, it should be seen as the nature of clear light, which is the

original: brtags pa'i snang ba med pa'i 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du blta'o/_/gnyis pa sa
analyzed: brtags pa'i snang ba med pa'i 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du blta'o/_/gnyis pa sa
translated: appearance of the imagined nature.

original: bon bsdu'o zhes pa/_'od gsal ba'i de nyid las sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du bo de🔽lnga med do/_/des las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la lha'i sa de'i steng du rtshi
analyzed: bon bsdu'o zhes pa/_'od gsal ba'i de nyid las sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du bo de lnga med do/_/des las byung ba'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la lha'i sa de'i steng du rtshi
translated: The second line, “The seed is gathered,” means that from the suchness of🔽clear light, the five seed syllables of the five aggregates arise in the same🔽way as the creation stage.🔽On the sun maṇḍala that arises from that, and so on, on top of the deity’s

original: las a'i steng du nyi ma gang byed pa'i bon dang bcas pa blta ste/_sa bon de'i 'od zer las
analyzed: las a'i steng du nyi ma gang byed pa'i bon dang bcas pa blta ste/_sa bon de'i 'od zer las
translated: seat, one should visualize the seed syllable of the deity.🔽From the light rays of that seed syllable, the emanations of the yoga

original: rnal 'byor ma'i rigs de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la thos mtha' yas pa'i sprul pas 'gro
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i rigs de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la thos mtha' yas pa'i sprul pas 'gro
translated: tantra, the tathāgatas, go to the ends of space.

original: ba rnams kyi don byas ste/_slar sa bon de nyid du nye bar bsdu ba'o/_/rang rig
analyzed: ba rnams kyi don byas ste/_slar sa bon de nyid du nye bar bsdu ba'o/_/rang rig
translated: one should gather back into that very seed syllable.🔽The third is called “the complete form.”

original: sgyu ma ci de las rang las nyi ma gsum pa la ni gzugs rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni/_sa bon de
analyzed: sgyu ma ci de las rang las nyi ma gsum pa la ni gzugs rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni/_sa bon de
translated: The seed syllable

original: nyid kyis sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba sogs pa'i gdan la
analyzed: nyid kyis sna tshhogs pad+ma'i lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zla ba sogs pa'i gdan la
translated: on a multicolored lotus in the center of the sun maṇḍala, on a seat of the sun, moon, and so on,

original: ro'i steng du phyed krung bcas pa'i gar gyis rol pa'i lha'i sku bskyed pa'o/_/bzhi🔽dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/🔽pa yi ge dgod pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bcu
analyzed: ro'i steng du phyed krung bcas pa'i gar gyis rol pa'i lha'i sku bskyed pa'o/_/bzhi dpal dgyes pa'i rdo rje'i dka' 'grel rin po che sbyor ba'i 'phreng ba zhes bya ba/ pa yi ge dgod pa'o zhes bya ba ni de nas rang gi snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bcu
translated: on top of a corpse, one should generate the deity’s form in the dance posture with the left leg extended.🔽The fourth is called “the placement of the syllables.”🔽One should place the seed syllable and so on in the center of one’s own heart,

original: dgu las gang rung cig go/_/de'i rang gi phyag mtshhan gyi lte bar sa bon la sogs pa la dgod pa ste/
analyzed: dgu las gang rung cig go/_/de'i rang gi phyag mtshhan gyi lte bar sa bon la sogs pa la dgod pa ste/
translated: on a sun maṇḍala, on top of a corpse, on a seat of the sun, moon, and so on,🔽on top of a corpse, in the dance posture with the left leg extended.

original: de dag bsgom pa 'di ni rnal 'byor sman pa'i ye shes dbang bskur tshhogs sog mi dgos ting nge
analyzed: de dag bsgom pa 'di ni rnal 'byor sman pa'i ye shes dbang bskur tshhogs sog mi dgos ting nge
translated: This meditation is the consecration of the wisdom of the physician yogi, the samadhi that does not require the accumulation of merit and so on.

original: 'dzin no/_/da ni rnal 'byor gnyis pa'i 'bring gi dbang du byas ste bsgrub thabs
analyzed: 'dzin no/_/da ni rnal 'byor gnyis pa'i 'bring gi dbang du byas ste bsgrub thabs
translated: Now, from the perspective of the medium of the second yoga, the method of practice is stated in the lines beginning “In front of oneself” and so on.

original: gsungs pa bcu mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa/_'dir yang stong nyid🔽byang chub kyi bar du sngon du 'gro ba'i yan lag rang la bstan 'jam pa la 'dug pa de nas raskas
analyzed: gsungs pa bcu mdun du zhes bya ba la sogs pa/_'dir yang stong nyid byang chub kyi bar du sngon du 'gro ba'i yan lag rang la bstan 'jam pa la 'dug pa de nas raskas
translated: Here, as before, the branch of going for refuge and so on up to the awakening of emptiness is taught.🔽Then, after performing the protection, one should make offerings to the deity and so on.

original: bsrung ba byas la ras ris la mchod pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas la tshhad med bzhi bsgoms la stong pa bsgom pa ni snga ma
analyzed: bsrung ba byas la ras ris la mchod pa bshags pa la sogs pa byas la tshhad med bzhi bsgoms la stong pa bsgom pa ni snga ma
translated: Having meditated on the four immeasurables, one should meditate on emptiness as before.

original: ltar byas la/_de las lhag par ram las nyi ma rnam par bsgom zhes bya ba la
analyzed: ltar byas la/_de las lhag par ram las nyi ma rnam par bsgom zhes bya ba la
translated: In addition to that, one should meditate on the sun from raṃ and so on.🔽One should perform the protection with the two verses beginning with “from that.”

original: sogs pa'i tshhigs su bcad pa gnyis pas bsrung bar bya'o/_/de yang dang por
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshhigs su bcad pa gnyis pas bsrung bar bya'o/_/de yang dang por
translated: First,

original: ram las me'i/_mdog can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la/_'od du zhu ba las der
analyzed: ram las me'i/_mdog can nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la/_'od du zhu ba las der
translated: one should generate a sun maṇḍala from raṃ, the color of fire, and from the melting of the light,🔽one should generate the seat of the deity.

original: hum las byung ba'i sna tshhogs rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang /_phyogs su rdo rje ra ba dang / steng du rdo rje dra ba bsam la phyi rol du rdo rje me 'bar ba bsgom ste/_om rak+sha
analyzed: hum las byung ba'i sna tshhogs rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang /_phyogs su rdo rje ra ba dang / steng du rdo rje dra ba bsam la phyi rol du rdo rje me 'bar ba bsgom ste/_om rak+sha
translated: Outside of that, meditate on blazing vajra fire.

original: rak+sha hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes bya ba de dag de lhag pa'i byin gyis brlab bo/_/'di
analyzed: rak+sha hu~m hu~m hu~m phat swa ha/_zhes bya ba de dag de lhag pa'i byin gyis brlab bo/_/'di
translated: Om rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: la yang bo de lngas skyed pa dang gzhal yas khang med de bsrung ba nang du ri la sogs pa'i gdan la'o/_/dang po
analyzed: la yang bo de lngas skyed pa dang gzhal yas khang med de bsrung ba nang du ri la sogs pa'i gdan la'o/_/dang po
translated: In this case, there is no creation from the five manifest enlightenments or celestial mansion, and the protection is on the seat of the corpse and so forth.🔽The first is the first of the yogas of the body.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor lus kyi dang po ste/_rdo rje ra ba'i bsrung ba'i nang du pam las
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor lus kyi dang po ste/_rdo rje ra ba'i bsrung ba'i nang du pam las
translated: Inside the protection wheel of the vajra fence, from paṃ

original: sna tshhogs pad+ma ram las la nyi ma la zla ba sogs pa'i steng du ro'i bdan rnam par bya ste/
analyzed: sna tshhogs pad+ma ram las la nyi ma la zla ba sogs pa'i steng du ro'i bdan rnam par bya ste/
translated: comes a multicolored lotus, from raṃ a sun, and from so on a moon, upon which is a corpse seat.🔽Why is the corpse seat a celestial seat here?

original: ci'i phyir 'dir lha'i bdan_/_/ro yin zhe na/_mkhas pas chos dbyings
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir lha'i bdan_/_/ro yin zhe na/_mkhas pas chos dbyings
translated: The wise one should express the nature of the dharmadhātu.

original: bdag nyid brjod zhes gsungs ste/_ro ni bdag med pa yin la/_bdag
analyzed: bdag nyid brjod zhes gsungs ste/_ro ni bdag med pa yin la/_bdag
translated: The corpse is selfless, and the self

analyzed: phyag mtshhan gyi steng du lte bar zer sa bon rgyu bsgom mo/_/zhes bya ba'i don to/_/lte ba'i sa

translated: the seed syllable of one’s deity is the discerning,🔽and the

analyzed: cad gcig gyur bya nan tan/_/rdzogs pa chos dbyings dag pa'o/_/zhes so/_/

analyzed: dpa' bo gcig pa gsum po de dag ni/_/lha thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'o/_/ da ni dgyes pa'i rdo rje gnyis pa bzhi drug pa bcu drug pa dang bzhi'o/_/bzhi dang bdag med pa'i dang yum bcas par bsgom na phyag bcu drug pa kho na'o/_/rnal 'byor gyi bzhi pa dkyil
translated: These three single heroes are common to all deities.🔽Now, if one meditates on Hevajra with two, four, six, or sixteen faces, it is only the sixteen-faced one.

analyzed: 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang bcas la bstan pa'i phyir/_dur khrod zhes bya ba la

translated: From paṃ, a lotus arises. Upon that, from the nine parts of the vowels and consonants, imagine nine parts of sun and moon seats.

analyzed: zla'i gdan cha dgu bsam/_dbus kyi nyi zla kha sbyar gyi nang du hum dang a las 'od 'phros nas slar 'dus pa las dgyes

analyzed: rdor yab yum gnyis bskyed la/_de'i zhal du dri za'i srog ho dmar po zhugs te snyoms par zhugs pa las 'khor gyi sa
translated: From that, Hevajra and Vajranairātmyā arise. The red hoh, the life of the gandharva, enters the mouth of the father.🔽From their union, the seed syllables of the retinue emanate onto the seats of the maṇḍala.

analyzed: bon gdan thog du spros te gtsho bo 'od du zhu nas lha mos phyis gsol ba btab nas bzhengs pa'o/_/gsol ba 'deb

analyzed: sku byed 'khor gyi de mo yin par 'dod do/_/de nas rdo rje ra ba'i nang du 'jigs su rung

analyzed: ba'i dur khrod brgyad bltas la/_de'i dbus su khang pa brtshegs pa'i nang du

analyzed: mgon po dgyes pa'i rdo rje 'go'u ri la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad kyis

analyzed: bskor ba bsgom mo/_/ro'i gnas su zhes bya ba ni/_dang po kho nas dben par bstan

analyzed: bde ba la 'dug ste de nas bdag dang gnas dang rnal 'byor bsrung ba byas la mdun gyi nam mkha' la dgyes pa'i rdo rje

analyzed: spyan drangs la phyi nang gi mchod pa lha mo brgyad kyis so/_/de kho na'i mchod pa ni ldom pa'i khyud pa'o/_/de nas sdig

analyzed: pa bshags pa dang bdun dag pa la sogs pa dang tshhad med bzhi dang stong nyid las gdan pad+ma de steng hum las sna tshhogs rdo

analyzed: rje de las rdo rje'i sa bzhi la sogs pa'i bsrung ba'i 'khor lo de chos 'byung gi nang du 'byung ba rim rtsheg dkyil 'khor gyi

analyzed: steng du bye las bzhal yas khang bskyed pa 'am yang rnam snang las gzhal yas khang bskyed rigs pa zhes bya ba ni

analyzed: nges pa'i tshhig la yi ge dbye bas dur khrod do gnyis pa dang dri sa zhes bya bas so/_/dur khrod

analyzed: bzhugs so/_/ji ltar lus dur khrod yin zhe na/_ro'i gnas pa'i rig pa 'dis/_dur khrod du ni mngon par brjod zhes bya'o/_/da ni dgyes pa'i rdo

analyzed: du'o gcig pa'o/_/gal te chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa'i mtha'i de kho na nyid

analyzed: las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid ni/_'bras bu yod pa ma yin zhe na/_rang rig las

translated: The great bliss of the mind itself is the great seal,

analyzed: po'i sems ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid de de nyid bsgom par bya'o/_/
translated: so the mind of great bliss, which is the nature of self-awareness, is the reality of the stage of completion, and that is what should be meditated upon.

original: las ngan las skyes na rang rig pa'i rang bzhin las rnams skye ste/_zhes bya ba las🔽rnams ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa rang rig gis las phyin ci log du zhen nas sems
analyzed: las ngan las skyes na rang rig pa'i rang bzhin las rnams skye ste/_zhes bya ba las rnams ni las dang las kyi rnam par smin pa rang rig gis las phyin ci log du zhen nas sems

analyzed: can rnams kyi lus dang /_gnas dang longs spyod sna tshhogs su snang ba ste/_de
translated: Actions are actions and the ripening of actions. Through self-awareness, actions are conceived in a distorted way, and the various appearances of the bodies, places, and enjoyments of sentient beings arise.

analyzed: dag de kho na nyid kyi rang rig pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'o/_/gal te de

analyzed: rang rig las sdud cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te/_'di la zos te chags sdang la sogs
translated: tasted, that is, having been attached to, hatred, and so on, the yogi

translated: One is the pristine consciousness of the five families inseparable from the great example. At the time of the karma consort, the pristine consciousness🔽of the five families is the essence of the five pristine consciousnesses of the🔽five elements, earth, and so on. Since that arises from the union of the two

analyzed: po zhes bya ba ni gsal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro/_/rang rig des ni sdug bsngal thams
translated: Moreover, that awareness is the king of suchness, or of action and so on, because it is the manifest.🔽Since that reflexive awareness possesses the power to eliminate all suffering, that reflexive awareness is the healer.

analyzed: yang gzhom par mi nus so/_/da ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir/

translated: The phenomena are the phenomena free from defilements, the🔽intention of the noble ones.🔽The source of those is the source of phenomena, which is the dharmadhatu.🔽In that way, the lotus source of phenomena is the source of phenomena

analyzed: chos 'byung las skyes ye shes so/_/ci 'dra zhe na/_mkha' mnyam zhes bya ba

analyzed: smos te/_nam mkha'i rang bzhin can no/_/thabs ni lam ste/_de yang thabs

analyzed: rnams kyi stong pa sku dang /_gsal ba gsung dang /_mi rtog pa thugs yongs su bsdus

analyzed: po'i ye shes ste/_nyams su myong ba'i chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te/

analyzed: gcig dang du ma la sogs pa'i rtog pa'i sgo nas dpyad pa'i gzhag pa dang bsgrub pa la sogs pa byar

analyzed: med pas skabs med pas gcig du mchog tu lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bsgom par bya

analyzed: ba'i don to/_/gal te de la dpyad pa'i skabs rtog pas mi 'jug na/_de kho na nyid

analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na/_rang gis rig pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te/

analyzed: des grogs byas nas rtogs pa'i yul lo/_/de nyid spyod yul ste so sor rang gis

translated: “Beyond” and “transcended” means that.

original: kyi sku dang /_gsung dang thugs yongs su bsdus pa ste/_de'i rang bzhin no/_/
analyzed: kyi sku dang /_gsung dang thugs yongs su bsdus pa ste/_de'i rang bzhin no/_/

analyzed: pa bsgom pa'i 'bras bu ston no/_/ji ltar sa la sogs pas mi 'ching zhe na/_de

analyzed: kho na nyid kyi sgom pa 'di la lhag par mos pa'i bsgom pa rnams/_sa 'og du 'dzul

analyzed: zhing gyen du 'ong ba dang /_ra ba dang ri la sogs pa la thogs pa med par 'gro

analyzed: cig rlung dang char la sogs pas mi rdzi ste/_de ltar gzhan dag la yang rlung dang me

analyzed: la yang sbyar bar bya'o/_/chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de kho na nyid shes pa rtogs pa yin/_/

translated: The two, Nairātmya and Bhūcari, are in the center of the lotus.🔽If it is asked, “Are they taught in the same way as in the Aṭṭahāsa?”🔽the other is mentioned because the name of Rūpavajrā is the same, but in fact, it is another goddess.

translated: They are as follows: the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the outer and inner, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of the absence of intrinsic nature, and the emptiness of the intrinsic nature.🔽The “sixteen emptinesses” are the sixteen emptinesses.

translated: emptiness of non-rejection,🔽emptiness of intrinsic nature,🔽emptiness of all phenomena,🔽emptiness of its own entity,🔽emptiness of non-entity,🔽emptiness of the entity of non-entity,🔽

translated: The four feet are the four kinds of feet. The four demons are as follows.🔽Since one knows that Brahma is devoid of inherent existence, one conquers the demon of the aggregates.🔽Since one knows that Ishvara is devoid of inherent existence, one conquers the demon of afflictions.

analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsams la de'i steng du hum las byung ba'i sna tshhogs rdo rje nyid

analyzed: dang /_de'i phyi rol du rdo rje'i me 'bar ba bsams la/_a+o~m rak+sha rak+sha rak+sha hum

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i khyim zhes bya ni/_byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la sogs
translated: The “house of the bodhisattva” is the temple of the bodhisattvas, such as Vajrapāṇi.

analyzed: dang /_shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur bas mnyam pa'i ro slob ma'i spyod yul

analyzed: dang bral ba'o/_/mkha' mnyam zhes bya ba ni/_nam mkha' ltar snang ba'i dngos
